intro: Ruschia evoluta, commonly known as the rolling leaf Ruschia, is a species of flowering plant in the Aizoaceae family. It is native to South Africa and is characterized by its unique, spirally twisted leaves that give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers in shades of yellow and orange, typically during the summer months. Ruschia evoluta is a succulent, meaning it stores water in its leaves and is adapted to arid environments. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and low maintenance requirements.
